segment.source: PowerShell scripts to help set up and manage your Microsoft Surface Hub .
segment.target: PowerShell scripts to help set up and manage your Microsoft Surface Hub .

segment.source: PowerShell scripts to help set up and manage your Microsoft Surface Hub .
segment.target: PowerShell scripts to help set up and manage your Microsoft Surface Hub .

segment.source: PowerShell scripts for Surface Hub admins
segment.target: PowerShell scripts for Surface Hub admins

segment.source: Create a device account using Office 365
segment.target: Create a device account using Office 365

segment.source: Creating a Surface Hub-compatible Exchange ActiveSync policy
segment.target: Creating a Surface Hub-compatible Exchange ActiveSync policy

segment.source: You can check online for updated versions at Surface Hub device account scripts.
segment.target: You can check online for updated versions at Surface Hub device account scripts.

segment.source: PowerShell scripts for Surface Hub administrators
segment.target: PowerShell scripts for Surface Hub administrators

segment.source: Create device accounts for setups using pure single-forest on-premises (Microsoft Exchange and Skype 2013 and later only) or online (Microsoft Office 365), that are configured correctly for your Surface Hub.
segment.target: Create device accounts for setups using pure single-forest on-premises (Microsoft Exchange and Skype 2013 and later only) or online (Microsoft Office 365), that are configured correctly for your Surface Hub.

segment.source: Validate existing device accounts for any setup (on-premises, online, or hybrid using Exchange or Lync 2010 or later) to make sure they're compatible with Surface Hub.
segment.target: Validate existing device accounts for any setup (on-premises, online, or hybrid using Exchange or Lync 2010 or later) to make sure they're compatible with Surface Hub.

segment.source: Provide a base template for anyone wanting to create their own device account creation or validation scripts.
segment.target: Provide a base template for anyone wanting to create their own device account creation or validation scripts.

segment.source: What do you need in order to run the scripts?
segment.target: What do you need in order to run the scripts?

segment.source: Remote PowerShell access to your organization's domain or tenant, Exchange servers, and Skype for Business servers.
segment.target: Remote PowerShell access to your organization's domain or tenant, Exchange servers, and Skype for Business servers.

segment.source: Admin credentials for your organization's domain or tenant, Exchange servers, and Skype for Business servers.
segment.target: Admin credentials for your organization's domain or tenant, Exchange servers, and Skype for Business servers.

segment.source: Note Whether you’re creating a new account or modifying an already-existing account, the validation script will verify that your device account is configured correctly.
segment.target: Note Whether you’re creating a new account or modifying an already-existing account, the validation script will verify that your device account is configured correctly.

segment.source: You should always run the validation script before adding a device account to Surface Hub.
segment.target: You should always run the validation script before adding a device account to Surface Hub.

segment.source: Create device accounts in your domain/tenant
segment.target: Create device accounts in your domain/tenant

segment.source: Create or assign a Surface Hub-compatible ActiveSync policy to the device account(s)
segment.target: Create or assign a Surface Hub-compatible ActiveSync policy to the device account(s)

segment.source: Set various attributes for the created account(s) in Exchange and Skype for Business.
segment.target: Set various attributes for the created account(s) in Exchange and Skype for Business.

segment.source: Assign licenses and permissions to the created account(s)
segment.target: Assign licenses and permissions to the created account(s)

segment.source: These are the attributes that are set by the scripts:
segment.target: These are the attributes that are set by the scripts:

segment.source: This is a Surface Hub room!
segment.target: This is a Surface Hub room!

segment.source: Set to the User Principal Name (UPN) of the device account
segment.target: Set to the User Principal Name (UPN) of the device account

segment.source: These scripts will create a device account for you.
segment.target: These scripts will create a device account for you.

segment.source: You can use the Account verification script to make sure they ran correctly.
segment.target: You can use the Account verification script to make sure they ran correctly.

segment.source: The account creation scripts cannot modify an already existing account, but can be used to help you understand which cmdlets need to be run to configure the existing account correctly.
segment.target: The account creation scripts cannot modify an already existing account, but can be used to help you understand which cmdlets need to be run to configure the existing account correctly.

segment.source: Creates an account as described in On-premises deployment.
segment.target: Creates an account as described in On-premises deployment.

segment.source: Create a device account using Office 365
segment.target: Create a device account using Office 365

segment.source: Creates an account as described in Create a device account using Office 365
segment.target: Creates an account as described in Create a device account using Office 365

segment.source: This script will validate the previously-created device account on a Surface Hub, no matter which method was used to create it.
segment.target: This script will validate the previously-created device account on a Surface Hub, no matter which method was used to create it.

segment.source: If one of the test errors out, it will show a detailed error message, but if all tests pass, the end result will be a summary report.
segment.target: If one of the test errors out, it will show a detailed error message, but if all tests pass, the end result will be a summary report.

segment.source: Details of specific settings will not be shown.
segment.target: Details of specific settings will not be shown.

segment.source: This script will enable Skype for Business on a device account.
segment.target: This script will enable Skype for Business on a device account.

segment.source: Use it only if Skype for Business wasn't previously enabled during account creation.
segment.target: Use it only if Skype for Business wasn't previously enabled during account creation.

segment.source: Creating a Surface Hub-compatible ActiveSync policy
segment.target: Creating a Surface Hub-compatible ActiveSync policy

segment.source: For Surface Hub to use Exchange services, a device account configured with a compatible ActiveSync policy must be provisioned on the device.
segment.target: For Surface Hub to use Exchange services, a device account configured with a compatible ActiveSync policy must be provisioned on the device.

segment.source: This policy has the following requirements:
segment.target: This policy has the following requirements:

segment.source: In the following cmdlets, is the name of the ActiveSync policy, and is the UPN of the device account you want to apply the policy to.
segment.target: In the following cmdlets, is the name of the ActiveSync policy, and is the UPN of the device account you want to apply the policy to.

segment.source: Note that in order to run the cmdlets, you need to set up a remote PowerShell session and:
segment.target: Note that in order to run the cmdlets, you need to set up a remote PowerShell session and:

segment.source: Your admin account must be remote-PowerShell-enabled.
segment.target: Your admin account must be remote-PowerShell-enabled.

segment.source: This allows the admin to use the PowerShell cmdlets that are needed by the script.
segment.target: This allows the admin to use the PowerShell cmdlets that are needed by the script.

segment.source: (This permission can be set using set-user )
segment.target: (This permission can be set using set-user )

segment.source: Your admin account must have the "Reset Password" role if you plan to run the creation scripts.
segment.target: Your admin account must have the "Reset Password" role if you plan to run the creation scripts.

segment.source: This allows the admin to change the password of the account, which is needed for the script.
segment.target: This allows the admin to change the password of the account, which is needed for the script.

segment.source: The Reset Password Role can be enabled using the Exchange Admin Center.
segment.target: The Reset Password Role can be enabled using the Exchange Admin Center.

segment.source: To apply the policy, the mailbox cannot be a room type, so it has to be converted into a user first.
segment.target: To apply the policy, the mailbox cannot be a room type, so it has to be converted into a user first.

segment.source: Now the device account just needs to be converted back into a room type.
segment.target: Now the device account just needs to be converted back into a room type.

segment.source: To allow an account , run the following command:
segment.target: To allow an account , run the following command:

segment.source: To find a device's ID, run:
segment.target: To find a device's ID, run:

segment.source: This retrieves device information for every device that the account has been provisioned on, Including the property.
segment.target: This retrieves device information for every device that the account has been provisioned on, Including the property.

segment.source: For a device account to automatically accept or decline meeting requests based on its availability, the AutomateProcessing attribute must be set to AutoAccept.
segment.target: For a device account to automatically accept or decline meeting requests based on its availability, the AutomateProcessing attribute must be set to AutoAccept.

segment.source: This is recommended as to prevent overlapping meetings.
segment.target: This is recommended as to prevent overlapping meetings.

segment.source: For a device account to accept external meeting requests (a meeting request from an account not in the same tenant/domain), the device account must be set to allow processing of external meeting requests.
segment.target: For a device account to accept external meeting requests (a meeting request from an account not in the same tenant/domain), the device account must be set to allow processing of external meeting requests.

segment.source: Once set, the device account will automatically accept or decline meeting requests from external accounts as well as local accounts.
segment.target: Once set, the device account will automatically accept or decline meeting requests from external accounts as well as local accounts.

segment.source: Note If the AutomateProcessing attribute is not set to AutoAccept, then setting this will have no effect.
segment.target: Note If the AutomateProcessing attribute is not set to AutoAccept, then setting this will have no effect.
